description: Borrowed from Latin bonus (“good”). Doublet of bona.

nouns.description: bonus (plural bonuses or bonusses or boni) ("boni" is nonstandard)

entries.meaning: Something extra that is good; an added benefit.
An extra sum given as a premium, e.g. to an employee or to a shareholder.
examples: The employee of the week receives a bonus for his excellent work.

entries.meaning: (video games) An addition to the player's score based on performance, e.g. for time remaining.
examples: Spend the time killing things and there's a bonus for each hit - but only for fatalities notched up since the start of your current life.

entries.meaning: (basketball) One or more free throws awarded to a team when the opposing team has accumulated enough fouls.

verbs.description: bonus (third-person singular simple present bonuses or bonusses, present participle bonusing or bonussing, simple past and past participle bonused or bonussed)
